text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make a mushroom arugula
and red onion salad with a lemon
vinaigrette here's what you need you
need some baby arugula washed and dry
Dijon mustard red onion fresh lemons
sliced mushrooms salt and pepper
and extra virgin olive oil now my
arugula I already bought it pre-washed
it's already washed and dry so it does a
lot of the work for me so I'm just going
to put that a really pretty Bowl
bring the bowl here okay that's so
pretty okay lovely now I'm going to add
in my sliced button mushrooms tossing
them just a little because the button
mushrooms are heavy clean hands cooks
best tool now I'm going to slice in a
little red onion slice it nice and thin
there we go now should be more than
enough I don't want a very strong onion
taste so I'm just going to just going to
do half okay nice and thin just going to
scatter it over my arugula in my
mushrooms okay oh this will take just a
second you're going to do the same salad
using fresh baby spinach or if you don't
even have it either you can just use
some romaine lettuce
I wouldn't recommend using like an
iceberg lettuce it just doesn't have
enough flavor for me just use a nice
dark green whatever you use make sure
it's nice and dark green okay
most done and we're going to make our
dressing here we go make my vinaigrette
I'm going to take my lemon we're just
going to roll it just to release the
juices if your lemon so it's really hard
and you you don't think it's going to
give you a lot of the juice pop it in
the microwave for 10 seconds you'll be
surprised what a difference it makes
okay let me get my Dijon mustard in
there first
about a teaspoon of Dijon mustard I love
using Dijon mustard for marinades and
dressings I think so so it tastes so
good it makes everything so creamy
I'm just juicing the lemon over my hands
and catch all the seeds okay probably
going to use the lemon and a half for
this you want about two to three
tablespoons of lemon yeah I'm just going
to use another half you can get a quick
roll okay now season this one
now I'm just going to salt and pepper it
I'm going to stream in my olive oil
whisking we like just emulsify it if you
do that your dressing will come on nice
and thick which mine has and it won't
separate now I suggest dressing it right
before you're going to serve it because
you will the acid in the lemon juice
well with down greens but I'm going to
serve it I'm going to dress it so I can
show you yeah give it a nice gentle toss
there you go oh so good like I said if
you can't find arugula which you should
be able to Decarie in every supermarket
nowadays you can always substitute with
a romaine or green leaf lettuce or even
if you wanted to some iceberg just not
my favorite here we go here you have it
it's super simple super easy but I
guarantee it's super delicious try it
let me know if you like it to get this
recipe and other recipes visit my
website at www.nerdkits.com and i see
you next time bye
